intro: Arachnothryx capitellata subsp. pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's arachnothryx, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Its unique botanical features include the presence of stipules and a distinctive inflorescence structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
